Function: add

Enter two numbers into the input boxes below and click submit. The sum of those two numbers should be displayed after clicking submit.

Function: subtract

Enter two numbers into the input boxes below and click submit. The difference of those two numbers should be displayed after clicking submit.

Function: tax

Enter a subtotal and tax % into the input boxes below. The total dollar amount of tax that should be paid should be displayed after clicking submit.

Function: stringLength

Enter a string into the input box below. If the string is less than 5 character long the words "short string" should be displayed. If the string is between 5 and 10 characters long the words "medium string" should be displayed. If the string is greater than 10 characters long the words "long string" should be displayed.

Function: startsWith

Enter a string into the input box below. If the string starts with:

  • "a" or "A" "starts with A" should be displayed.
  • "b" or "B" "starts with B" should be displayed.
  • "c" or "C" "starts with C" should be displayed.
  • "d" or "D" "starts with D" should be displayed.
  • "e" or "E" "starts with E" should be displayed.
  • anything else "starts with something else" should be displayed.

Function: stringRepeat

Enter a string (s) and a number (n) into the input boxes below. The string repeated n times should be displayed after clicking submit.

Function: nSum

Enter a number (n) into the input boxes below. The sum of the numbers 1 though n should be displayed after submit.

Function: join

Select options from the box below (shift+click to select multiple). Enter a spacer string into the input box below. After clicking submit the items that you selected from the list, separated by the string you entered in the input box should be displayed.

Function: countLetters

Enter a string into the input box below and click submit. The count of each letter in the string should be displayed. Foe example if you entered "cat", the output would be: "c: 1, a: 1, t: 1". Similarly if you entered "alakazam" the output would be: "a: 4, l: 1, k: 1, z: 1, m: 1". The order of the letters in the output does not matter.

Function: maze

There is no input for this function. Instead, your function should take no arguments and return a matrix (array of arrays). Each position in the matrix represents a block in the maze. If it has a boolean value of true, then that particular block with be a wall. If it has a boolean value of false then that particular block will be empty. If it has a string value of "start", it will mark the starting position. If it has a string value of end, it will mark the ending position (red X). Create an interesting maze to navigate through.

Function: table

The table function takes an array of objects. Each object (element of the array) has the following properties:

  • Year
  • Make
  • Model
  • Color
The table function also takes year, make, model and color filters. If any of the filters are filled in (ie. not an empty string), the function should return an array of objects that exactly match the filter criteria.

Year Make Model Color
